author: Marcus Mührmann-Lund

text: I have both ToS and ToS: DotnW. While I can't really determine the better of the two (They are both excellent IMO, I like the universe) the music in both games is excellent as ever. I prefer the music in DotNW, but I like the overall atmosphere and story of the first one. And both music and story make a game, but both games have a story and followed with good music to create a nice atmosphere.

author: Hadron

text:
I loved this game! Sure there were repetitive fights (auto-fight eases some pain), but the story was good (imo) and controls were just right (lack of wiimote's use did disappoint a bit thought). Music was awesome. Overall worth 8/10 try it out.
First play through took me around 30 hours (no bonuses whatsoever)

author: SupraDarky

text: I chose this over the original version since I finished this﻿ game a couple hours ago (and I like both versions). I have to say I was impressed with this game, it's strangely addicting especially after a couple hours when you have your monsters (which ended up being overpowered). The battle system was as solid as ever and it felt nice to revisit the first game's universe. The story wasn't anything special but it finished on a high note. Overall a nice sequel/spin-off.
author: SupraDarky
